availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin Botts (Fleming County, Kentucky, farmer & sheriff)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff. Kentucky native. Son of John H. Botts. Married to Juliet E. Dorsey Botts. Father of Mary W. Botts, Henry Botts, John H. Botts, Anna Botts, Seth Botts, Amelia Botts, George W. Botts, and Juliet E. Botts. Farmer in Fleming County in 1850. Employed John Warrick as a farmer in Fleming County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Fleming County in 1850. Farmer in Fleming County in 1860. Employed Joseph I. Dorsey, Charles Dorsey, and Michael Welch as laborers in Fleming County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Fleming County in 1860. Sheriff of Fleming County from 1862 to 1863.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 5.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 8.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Flemingsburg, p. 416A.

“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1863,” in 1864 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 10. (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1864), 301-306.
